results.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell and David O. Selznick
results.brief_description: Cedric is a spoilt child brought up in Brooklyn in the 1880’s who inherits an English title and finds his life transformed. In his stately family home in England, Cedric wins over his stern grandfather (C. Aubrey Smith). Freddie Bartholomew stars in the title role and is well supported by Dolores Costello as his mother and Mickey Rooney as the bootblack.

results.title: Little journey
results.creator_credit: Keith Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Keith remembers little of his early years - separated from his parents and living with his grandparents. His father had been sent to a Re-education Camp and his mother had moved away. On his father’s release from the Camp the family was reunited and several years later they escaped from the hardships of Vietnam to seek a better life in Australia.

results.title: Little Johnny Jones
results.creator_credit: Gary Halvorson, Bill Siegler, Showtime Entertainment and Group W Cable Productions
results.brief_description: This Goodspeed Opera House production of George M. Cohan’s classic American musical “Little Johnny Jones” is performed on stage in front of a live audience and features such hit songs as “Yankee Doodle Dandy” and “Give my regards to Broadway”. The cast includes Eric Weitz as Johnny Jones and Peter Van Norden as Anthony Anstey, with Lenny Wolpe, Ernie Sabella, Bruce Chew, Jack Bittner, Maureen Brennan, Anna Mcneely, Jane Galloway. Book, music and lyrics by George M. Cohan adapted by Alfred Uhry and stage direction by Gerald Gutierrez.
